text: (upbeat music)

- I got a job at a small
tech company in New Jersey
where I lived at the time
and they didn't have any product managers.

I said, well, I should
be the product manager

because I'm the one that
talks to the customers
and understands what they need.
So I became the first product manager
for that very small 50 person company.
And I just had an affinity for it,

sort of being in between
the tech and the people
and the business.
And it just went from there.
We got acquired

and then had the opportunity
to come to work for Amazon
and I couldn't say no.
(upbeat music)

I mean, I've always been
so impressed by Amazon

and the way that they're
just constantly innovating

in ways that you just
can't imagine are possible.

Things that weren't
impossible become possible.
And I wanted to learn how that happened.

And I knew that people were
gonna be incredibly smart
and I was wrong.
They were like, amazingly smart.
Even smarter than I expected.

Yeah, when you think
smart people, you think,

oh people who are kind
of in their ivory tower
doing their own thing.
It's smart collaboration.
And so, you're constantly collaborating
and working with people across Amazon.

I mean, every day I have
to talk to somebody else

from a different service
or from a different group
that we need to collaborate together
as well as folks within my group.
And it's just amazing how open people are,
that we wanna help each other

because we know we're
helping our customers.
AMS stands for AWS Managed Services.

We're here to partner
with our customers on AWS

to help them accelerate
their adoption of the Cloud.
And so that they can focus on innovation

and we can focus on their
operations for them.
(upbeat music)
We are working with the most innovative,
exciting companies in the world

as they innovate on behalf
of their organizations
and their customers.
We get to solve the hard problems

with incredibly innovative
solutions every single day.
(upbeat music)
